text:
I never played Chrono Trigger or Chrono Cross, but over the last several months I've been listening to their soundtracks, they are without a doubt, the best music I've ever heard in my life, not just game music, but the best music period...

I just bought Chrono Trigger on Steam for $7.00
Eager to start playing after work. :)

author: BeleuchteteBrueder

text: @BeleuchteteBrueder¬†I'm not sure why you are so upset, I wasn't trying to be smart or funny, I was just saying that shiver star from Kirby 64 came after Chrono Trigger and had to be inspired from it.
author: Vidyagamesnake

text: @116410692555521347954 Sorry if I overreacted. It's just that I have been listening to this great playlist for the last few weeks and there are a lot of comments that get commented on in this fashion. I just wanted to make the point that it is irrelevant, what game was first. If you know a game (like Kirby) and you listen to this tune for the first time, you feel reminded of it. No need to point out that this isn't completely correct. One of the great things about VGM is how it triggers memories and is seemingly all connected. There was really nothing wrong with your paticular comment, it was just the one that made me wanted to shout out: "stop correcting people in this manner!" :) no offense. (and by the way... I am no native speaker, I am not really sure about the exact connotation of "smartass", I always thought of it as a very moderate term)

author: CNile

text: Actually, some of the Zeal folks managed to survive the fall, so the human race would have continued. Without sacrificing herself to save the party, the rest of them could have taken up where the dead ones left off, assuming Lucca or Robo stayed in the End of Time. Without her pacifistic nature, she could have toasted her crazy mom and saved her people. Then again, I don't blame her because I am like that too; not everyone can be a completely selfless silent protagonist.

author: OutOfTheShadows

text:
Schala is such a brilliant character. Without her, the entire planet would have died out several times over. Without her compassion for those without magic, the human race would have died out. Without her sacrificing herself to save the party, Lavos would have destroyed the planet. Without her guidance, Magus would have grown up to be a far more dangerous figure.

One of the most underrated characters in any game ever.

text:
I never had that much sympathy for Schala.  She was pretty much responsible for the world being ruined, because she had no willpower to stand up to the prophet (when he threw the heroes in the portal) and Queen Zeal (by powering the Mammon Machine).

If she had just stood up for what was right, the world would have been saved.
